description.narrative:
The overall development goal of the project is to contribute to reducing poverty by improving the maritime traffic safety and hereby contribute to regional development and economic growth.
The immediate objective is to establish a national ship reporting system consisting of ship reporting stations on 18 locations spread across the country and a vessel traffic service consisting of two surveillance systems in the Sunda and Lombok Straits.
The increased traffic safety will result in a reduction in marine accidents, fewer damages to people and material and mitigation of pollution, illegal fishing and piracy.
In addition, the project will improve the chances of completing rescue missions.
The project will also contribute to increasing employment opportunities as well as national and international trade.
